text: hello everyone this is psyched banerjee
a database specialist solutions
architect with amazon web services
today i'll briefly talk about query plan
management
a highly popular feature in amazon
aurora postgresql
amazon aurora is a mysql and postgresql
compatible
relational database built for the cloud
that combines
the performance and availability of
traditional commercial databases
with the cost and simplicity of open
source databases
query plan management helps you sustain
your database performance
by providing plan stability adaptability
and consistently optimal database
performance
it does this even with the changes that
could cause
otherwise problems in execution plan or
database performance
so without further delay let's take a
closer look
at this really cool feature customers
want their applications
to consistently deliver high performance
today's business critical applications
need to run at their peak performance
all the time to meet the desired sla or
service level agreement there are
various factors that can unexpectedly
change
the execution plan of queries for
example
changing the optimizer statistics either
manually or automatically
changes to the query planner
configuration parameters
changes to the schema such as adding new
index
or changes to the bind variables used in
the query
or minor or major version upgrades to
the postgresql database version
all this can cause sql plan regression
which can cause significant performance
degradation in your application
so we need to have a plan stability
mechanism
to avoid this issue
on the other hand minor changes in
environment
such as configuration parameter changes
can
improve sql execution plan and in that
case
better plan should be accepted and sql
statements
should adapt to those changes the aurora
postgresql query plan management
as known as qpm feature
solves this problem of plan instability
by allowing database users to maintain a
stable
yet optimal performance for a set of
managed sql statements
qpm primarily serves two main objectives
first it provides plan stability qpm
prevents plan regression
and improves plan stability when any of
the above changes
occur in the system secondly
it provides plan adaptability
qpm automatically detects new minimum
cost plans
and controls when new plans may be used
and adapts
to the changes
qpm supports manage statements execution
plans for statements
that cannot be changed in applications
or hints cannot be added
can be improved using qpm
each manage statement has one or more
plans
plans can be captured either manually or
automatically
in most cases you set up qpm to use
automatic plan capture
so that plans are captured for all
statements that run two or more times
however you can also capture plans for a
specific set of statements that you
specify manually
to do this you set capture plan
baselines to off
by default and at the session level you
set capture plan baselines to manual
each plan can be approved unapproved
or rejected the first plan found for a
statement is
always approved each additional plan for
each statement
is initially unapproved
qpm provides apg plan management
dot evol plan baselines function to
compare plans
based on their actual performance
depending on the outcome of your
performance experiments
you can change your plan status from
unapproved to either approved or
rejected
you can instead decide to use the apg
plan management dot evol plan baselines
functions
to temporarily disable a plan if it does
not meet your requirements
now let's take a closer look how qpm
works
the cost of an execution plan is an
estimate that the optimizer makes to
compare different plans
optimizer cost is a function of several
factors
that include the cpu and i operations
that the plan uses
this flowchart shows how qpm works
let me explain steps one to nine in the
flowchart diagram
so when the optimizer processes a sql
statement
it generates a minimum cost plan
when qpm is not enabled the optimizer
simply executes the minimum cost plan
when it is enabled the optimizer uses
query plan management
next if the optimizer determines the sql
statement is not a manage statement
it executes the generated minimum cost
plan
if the manual or automatic capture is
enabled the optimizer goes through the
capture plan processing and if
use plan baselines option is not enabled
the optimizer runs the minimum cost plan
if the optimizer generated plan is not a
stored plan
the optimizer captures and stores the
plan as a new unapproved plan
and if the plan is not a rejected or
disabled
optimizer picks the generated plan for
execution
optionally you can configure qpm to
simply execute any plan that has an
estimated cost below
a threshold that you specify this avoids
plan enforcement overhead for trivial
plans
if the manage statement has any enabled
and valid preferred plans the optimizer
runs the minimum cost one
if one or more preferred plans exist
then the optimizer recosts
each preferred plans and selects the
minimum cost preferred plan that can be
recreated optimizer chooses the approved
and enabled minimum cost plan for
execution if no preferred plans exist
or can be recreated then the optimum
optimizer
request each approved plan and select
the minimum cost approved plan if no
preferred or approved plan exists or can
be created
then the optimizer's minimum cost plan
is used as a last resort
next we will see some hands-on
demonstration
of query plan management feature in this
demonstration
i'll show how to enable qpm how to
capture
the sql plans and use those captured sql
plans
so first i'll go to the parameter group
of my cluster
i can see this cluster is using powder
qpm db cluster parameter group
i'll modify the enable plan management
parameter
i'll modify this rds dot enable plan
management parameter
this will enable the support for apg
plan management
extension
next i'll change the
apg plan management capture plan
baseline parameter value to automatic
this will ensure all the sql plans are
captured automatically
next i'll modify the apg plan management
dot use plan baseline parameter to
true
this will ensure the
qpm can use the captured
sql plans
i'll click save changes
next i'll reboot the
writer instance to make sure the static
parameter changes
taking to effect
i have connected to the aurora cluster
let's verify the error cluster version i
can see the aurora version is 3.3.1
which is postgresql 11.8 compatible
let's create the apg plan management
extension
let's verify if the extension has been
created correctly
i can see the extension has been created
with the extension version 2.0
let's verify if plan management has been
enabled for this cluster
we can see that plan management has been
enabled as we change this parameter
in the cluster parameter group let's
verify if automatic plan capture is
enabled
we can see that automatic plan capture
has been enabled
we modified the parameter in the cluster
parameter group and i can verify here
now let's see if the plan usage is
enabled
we can see that plan usage has been
enabled
and the value is on i have already
initialized the database with pg bench
data
i'll use pg bench which is a postgresql
benchmarking tool
to generate a simulated workload
next i'll query the apg plan management
dot dba plans table to view the manage
statements and the execution plans for
the sql statements
issued with the pg bench tool
let's verify if automatic plan capture
has been disabled
next let's verify the execution plan of
the manage statement
is the same as plan captured by the qpm
yes we can see the planet's value
here is same what we saw in the
dba plan stable
in addition to the automatic plan
capture
qpm also offers manual capture which
offers a mechanism to capture execution
plans
for known problematic queries capturing
the plans automatically
is recommended generally however there
are situations where capturing plans
manually would be
the best option such as you don't want
to enable plan management at the
database level
but you do want to control a few
critical sql statements only
or you want to save the plan for a
specific set of literals
or parameter values that are causing a
performance problem
in this section i showed you how to
enable qpm
how to enable automatic plan capture and
review
capture plan in db underscore plan table
now i'll generate a better execution
plan using pg hint
then using qpm i'll show how to ensure
that
execution plan is used by the query even
without pg hint
first let's check if the plant capture
is disabled
let's see how the original plan of the
query looks like
without hint
so we can see it's using nested loop and
it is generating a particular plan hash
value
next i'll enable pg hint plan
and manual plan capture
next i'll use pg hint to generate a
better execution plan
here i'll use hash join hint which is a
directive to the optimizer to choose the
joint method as hash join
let's see the explained query with the
hints
so as you see instead of nested loop it
it is currently using hash join with
this hint
and it generated a new plan hash value
next
i'll verify if this plan was captured
so i can see this plan was captured
but the status is unapproved
for this particular sequel
in general to reject all existing plans
for a statement and then approve
one specific plan you could call apg
plan management dot
set plan status twice let me show you
how we can do that
i rejected all existing plans
and now i approve only specific plan
next i'll remove the hint turn up the
manual capture
and turn on use plan baseline
i'll also verify that the desired plan
is in use
even without the hint
we can verify even without the hint the
query is using
the planner value and it's performing a
hash join operation
in this way you can
[Music]
use hints to control the query optimizer
but then you can remove the hints and
allow kpm to enforce that desired plan
without adding hints to your application
code just to clarify here
the force plan here has a higher cost
value than the
default plan since this is just a
demonstration
but in real-world use cases you would
want to force a plan
with lower cost value next
i'll show the plan adaptability feature
of qpm
how qpm can adapt to a better plan
as they're available
i'll enable manual plan capture to
install qpm to capture the execution
plan of the desired sql statements
manually
in most cases you set up qpm to use
automatic plan capture so that plans are
captured for all statements
that run two or more times however
you can also capture plans for a
specific set of statements that you
specify manually
like i did here next
i'll run an explain plan for the query
so that qpm can capture the plan of the
query
i'll see if the plan has been captured
as i ran the query
as you see i can confirm
the plan has been captured in the apg
plan management dot dba plans table
i can also see the plan status as
approved this is the same plan from the

explain plan output again
to see the qpm approve plan is used by
the query optimizer
next i'll create a new index on the bgbh
history table
column m time to change the planner
configuration
and force the query optimizer to
generate a new plan
now let's view the explained pan output
again
and we see qpm detects a new plan
but still uses the approved plan and
maintains the plan stability
please note at the message
at the end of the plan results
that an approved plan was used instead
of the minimum cost plan
to ensure plan stability qpm stores all
the newly generated plan for a managed
query in the qpm
as unapproved plans let's see what are
the plans available to qpm
for this statement now
the output shows that there are two
different plans
stored for the same manage statement as
shown by
the two different hash values
although the execution plan has the
minimum cost
lower than the approved plan qpm
continues to ignore the
unapproved plan to maintain plan
stability
next i'll show the example of planned
adaptability with qpm
this example evaluates the unreported
plans based on the minimum speed up
factor
it approves any captured unapproved
plans that is faster by
at least 10 percent than the best
approved plan
for the statement
as we see here one unapproved plan
changed to approved
upm provides this apg plan management
evolve plan baseline function to compare
plans based on their actual performance
depending on the outcome of your
performance experiments you can change a
plan status from
unapproved to either approved or
rejected
you can instead decide to use the apg
plan management
dot evolve plan baseline function to
temporarily disable a plan
if it does not meet your requirements
now let's see if the plan status change
to approved
in the apg plan management dot dba plans
table as you see here after qpm
evaluates the plan based on the speed
factor
the plan status change to approve as you
see
the query is using the newly approved
plan
which is better one than the plans
before creating the index
and which is having a much lower cost
so qpm can adapt to better sql plans
as they are available so here are the
key benefits of using query plan
management
if you refresh statistics add an index
change parameters
or upgrade to a new version of amazon
aurora qpm detects a new plan
but still uses the approved plan and
maintains the plan stability
because the qpm error optimizer executes
only minimum cost approved plans
you can compare statement by statement
plan changes
due to usage of new postgresql features
and decide to use those features
only if the performance improves
in some cases the query optimizer does
not generate the best execution plan for
the query
one approach to fixing this problem is
to put query hints
into your application code but this
approach is widely discouraged
because it makes application more
brittle and harder to maintain
and in some cases you can't hint the sql
because it is generated by a third party
application
so you can use hints to control the
query optimizer
but then the to remove the hints and
allow qpm to enforce the desired plan
without adding hints to the application
code since the qpma optimizer
executes only minimum cost approved
plans
this minimizes plan regression and can
greatly reduce
time to fix
large enterprise customers often have
applications
and database deployed globally they also
often maintain several environments
like development qa staging uat pre-prod
and prod
for each application database however
managing
the execution plans manually in each of
the database in specific aws region
and each of the database environments
can be cumbersome and time consuming
qpm provides an option to export and
import qpm managed plans from one
database to another database
with this option you can manage the
query execution centrally
and deploy databases globally
this feature is useful for scenarios
where you use investigate a set of plans
on a prepared database
verify that they perform well and then
load them into
a production database thank you very
much for watching this video
i hope you liked it and you will be
using this really cool feature
in your environment to achieve superior
sql performance
and stability in your application
thanks again and happy cloud computing
from
